title: Mushroom–Barley Risotto
description: A creamy, savory risotto-style dish made with pearl barley and a mix of mushrooms, finished with Parmesan and fresh herbs. Slow-simmering barley absorbs a mushroom–white wine broth for deep umami flavor and a toothsome, comforting texture.

ingredients.display_name: mixed mushrooms (cremini, shiitake, oyster), cleaned and sliced

ingredients.notes: can substitute additional stock if preferred
adjust to taste and stock saltiness

steps.text: Prepare ingredients: rinse barley, slice mushrooms, finely dice onion, mince garlic, grate Parmesan, and keep vegetable stock hot in a saucepan over low heat.

Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil and 20 g butter in a large heavy-bottomed sauté pan over medium-high heat. Add sliced mushrooms in a single layer (in batches if necessary) and cook without stirring for 2–3 minutes to develop color, then stir and sauté until mushrooms are golden and their liquid has mostly evaporated.
Transfer sautéed mushrooms to a bowl and keep warm. Add remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil to the pan, reduce heat to medium, add diced onion and a pinch of salt, and cook until translucent and soft.
Add minced garlic and thyme to the onions and cook for 1 minute until fragrant, stirring constantly to prevent burning.
Add rinsed pearl barley to the pan and stir to coat grains with fat; toast the barley, stirring, for 2 minutes until edges become slightly translucent.
Pour in the white wine, increase heat to medium-high, and simmer, stirring, until the wine is almost completely absorbed by the barley.

Begin adding hot vegetable stock a ladleful (about 120 ml) at a time: add, stir gently until mostly absorbed, then add the next ladle. Continue this process, stirring fairly often, for 20–25 minutes until barley is tender with a slight bite and the mixture is creamy.

When barley is nearly done, stir the cooked mushrooms back into the pan along with remaining 40 g butter, grated Parmesan, lemon zest if using, and chopped parsley. Adjust seasoning with salt and pepper.
Remove from heat, cover and rest for 2 minutes to meld flavors, then serve immediately with extra Parmesan and a drizzle of olive oil if desired.
